programme.title: Brothers
programme.desc: An innocent black youth succumbs to the brutalities of prison after being duped into pleading guilty to robbery.

programme.title: Super Fly
programme.desc: Before a Harlem cocaine dealer (Ron O'Neal) retires with his girlfriend (Sheila Frazier), he wants to make just one last score.

programme.title: Black Belt Jones
programme.desc: A martial artist (Jim Kelly) helps a father (Scatman Crothers) and daughter (Gloria Hendry) save their school of self-defense from Los Angeles mobsters.

programme.title: Three the Hard Way
programme.desc: A record producer (Jim Brown), a PR man (Fred Williamson) and a black belt (Jim Kelly) in karate foil a racist plot to poison part of a city.

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: The Queen Boxer
programme.desc: An avenger (Judy Lei) of murder destroys a crime ring with her kung fu.

programme.title: The Black Dragon Vs. The Yellow Tiger
programme.desc: In one of the earliest and least-seen Bruceploitation epics, Tong Lung (THE FEROCIOUS BROTHERS) assumes the mannerisms to star in this very unofficial sequel to Bruce Lee's THE WAY OF THE DRAGON.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.sub-title: Lee Morgan; Horace Silver; Bobbi Humphrey
programme.desc: Jazz lineup features pianist Horace Silver at the electric keyboard, Lee Morgan on trumpet and 22-year old Bobbi Humphrey playing the flute; vocalists Andy and Salome Bey.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: One of the great Motown acts of the past several years headlines, performing the hit, "I Heard It through the Grapevine," and other selections.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Al Green sings "Let's Stay Together"; author Verta Mae Grosvenor reads form her latest book, "Thursdays and Every Other Sunday Off."

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Merry Clayton; the Reverend Jesse Jackson talks with host Ellis Haizlip about his newly formed organization, People United to Save Humanity (PUSH).

programme.title: Blackstar Warrior
programme.desc: In a 1970s version of the future, a space detective searching for the truth about his real mother uncovers his adoptive parents' secret genetics lab and discovers it's controlled by a space nun cult bent on taking over the galaxy.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: The Black Cobra
programme.desc: A detective (Fred Williamson) protects a murder witness (Eva Grimaldi) from a vicious gang of bikers.

programme.title: The Black Cobra 2
programme.desc: Interpol pairs a Chicago policeman (Fred Williamson) with an inspector (Nicholas Hammond) on the trail of terrorists in Manila.

programme.title: Black Cobra 3: Manila Connection
programme.desc: An agent (Forry Smith) teams up with his father's buddy (Fred Williamson) on a jungle mission to recover stolen weapons.

programme.title: Disorderlies
programme.desc: A greedy heir (Anthony Geary) hires three inept, rap-singing orderlies (The Fat Boys) to care for his rich uncle (Ralph Bellamy).

programme.title: Hangin' With the Homeboys
programme.desc: Willie (Doug E. Doug), Tom (Mario Joyner), Johnny (John Leguizamo) and Vinny are fast-talkers from the South Bronx looking for a party.
